cheatsheetvideos.quote: Karla only needed to Study for 1 hour. She then went to the DMV and Passed her test
DMV Test Cheat Sheet: John Tells us How to Ace The Driver’s Test On your First Try

questions.question: On a multilane road, a dashed yellow line next to a solid yellow line means:
questions.answerA: Passing is prohibited from both directions.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from both directions.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted only from the direction next to the dashed line.
questions.explanation: Where there are both solid and dashed yellow lines between lanes of traffic, only traffic directly next to the dashed line may cross the centerline to pass. Drivers next to the solid line may not pass.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: All roads are slippery and dangerous when wet. This sign warns of conditions that can cause a driver to lose control of a car. A driver should slow down when coming upon wet pavement because it takes longer to stop.

questions.question: What does this road sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

questions.question: You may pass on the right of another vehicle:
questions.answerA: When traveling either on a multilane highway or on a street with an available turning lane.
questions.answerB: Only when traveling on a multilane highway with two or more lanes of traffic traveling in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Only when the other vehicle is making or is about to make a left turn and a lane is provided for you to pass on the right.
questions.explanation: You may pass on the right of another vehicle making or about to make a left turn if there is sufficient pavement width for both your vehicle and the vehicle making the left turn. You may also pass on the right when traveling on a multilane highway carrying two or more lanes of traffic in the same direction.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a minimum blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of:
questions.explanation: For drivers age 21 or older, it is illegal to operate a motor vehicle with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.08 percent or higher. Driving while under the influence of alcohol is not only illegal, but dangerous.

questions.question: To be able to turn quickly, your hands must be:
questions.answerA: On opposite sides of the steering wheel.
questions.answerB: Next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.
questions.answerC: On the top and bottom of the steering wheel.
questions.explanation: Both hands should be placed on opposite sides of the steering wheel. This position is comfortable and promotes safe turning on high-speed roadways.

questions.question: Temporary signs used in construction and maintenance work areas:
questions.answerA: Have a red background with green writing.
questions.answerB: Have an orange background with black writing.
questions.answerC: Have a yellow background with blue writing.
questions.explanation: All temporary signs in work zones have orange backgrounds with black writing and/or symbols.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

questions.question: A steady green traffic light at an intersection means:
questions.answerC: You may continue through the intersection at a safe and reasonable speed, if it is clear to do so.
questions.explanation: A steady green traffic light indicates that the driver may continue through the intersection. The driver should yield to traffic or pedestrians already in the intersection and proceed when the intersection is clear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Right turn on red light permitted with caution.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate the the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
questions.answerC: Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

questions.question: If a child is riding a bicycle near your vehicle:
questions.answerB: Expect the child to be in total control of the bicycle.
questions.explanation: Children on bicycles are sometimes unpredictable. Young bicyclists are especially likely to make surprising changes in direction. Remember that children and bicycles are both small in stature and may become difficult to see.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a steep downgrade is ahead on the road. Drivers should check their brakes.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?
questions.answerA: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.
questions.answerB: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.
questions.answerC: Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.
questions.explanation: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. You cannot make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: A steady yellow traffic signal light is a warning that the light is about to change to red. If you are already within the intersection when a green light changes to yellow, you should:
questions.answerB: Continue moving and clear the intersection safely.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed so as not to cause an accident.
questions.explanation: If you are already within an intersection when the traffic light turns yellow, you should clear the intersection as quickly as possible.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive:
questions.answerA: Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead than you can.
questions.answerB: Farther behind the truck than you would when following a passenger vehicle.
questions.answerC: No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you.
questions.explanation: When you follow so closely behind a truck that you cannot see the truck driver’s side view mirrors, the trucker cannot see you and has no way of knowing you are there. Tailgating a truck, or any vehicle, is dangerous because you take away your own cushion of safety if the vehicle in front of you stops quickly.

questions.question: When you want to change lanes, you should never:
questions.answerA: Move into another lane while within an intersection.
questions.answerB: Check your blind spot by looking over your shoulder.
questions.answerC: Check for other drivers moving into the same lane.
questions.explanation: You should never change lanes within an intersection. Before changing lanes, always look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. Be alert to other drivers moving into the same lane.

questions.question: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign.
questions.explanation: Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

questions.question: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should:
questions.answerA: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
questions.answerB: Merge across two lanes at once.
questions.answerC: Always stop before entering the highway.
questions.explanation: Anytime you want to merge with other drivers, you need to find a gap large enough for you to safely enter into the flow of traffic. You should not stop on the entrance ramp to an interstate highway unless there are no gaps into which you may safely merge.

questions.question: When driving in fog or mist, never put your headlights on the high beam setting because:
questions.answerA: The light will reflect back into your eyes.
questions.answerB: Approaching vehicles might not see you.
questions.answerC: Vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
questions.explanation: In foggy or misty conditions, you should not use your headlights on their high beam setting because the light will be reflected back into your eyes.

questions.question: Streets and highways are most slippery:
questions.answerA: When it has been raining hard for several hours.
questions.answerB: When they are clean and dry.
questions.answerC: Just after it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: Driving during the first half hour of rainfall is dangerous because roadways become extremely slippery when the water mixes with oil and other chemicals on the road surfaces that have not yet washed away. Use extra caution when driving on slippery roads.

questions.question: This sign tells you that:
questions.answerA: No turns are allowed on the road.
questions.answerC: There is a series of curves ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

questions.question: This sign indicates a:
questions.explanation: Yellow signs with black markings are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazards or special conditions. Round signs are used only to warn about upcoming railroad crossings.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign is displayed on slow-moving vehicles.

questions.question: It is more dangerous to drive at night than during the day because:
questions.answerA: You cannot see as far ahead at night.
questions.answerB: The road is always more slippery at night.
questions.answerC: Your reaction time is slower at night.
questions.explanation: With decreased visibility and the glare of oncoming headlights, you cannot see as far ahead at night as you can during the day. Always use headlights and exercise caution when driving in the dark.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Change in direction or narrowing of roadway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns a driver of a change in direction or a narrowing of the road. A driver may find several of these signs on the outside of a sharp curve or on approaches to a narrow bridge.

questions.question: You may legally block an intersection:
questions.answerA: If you entered the intersection on the green light.
questions.explanation: Even if the light is green, you may not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign is used to warn drivers about an upcoming curve to the right.

questions.question: Using a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
questions.answerA: It causes the driver to be concerned about the cost of the call.
questions.answerB: It occupies the driver's hands, eyes, and mind.
questions.answerC: It is an activity that draws the attention of other drivers.
questions.explanation: Using a cell phone while driving is dangerous because it occupies the user's eyes, hands, and mind. Even the most skilled drivers increase their risk of being involved in a crash by using a cell phone on the road.

questions.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:
questions.answerB: Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

questions.question: This sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing that does not have a signal. You should:
questions.answerB: Proceed at a consistent speed while looking and listening for approaching trains.
questions.answerC: Slow down, look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing marked with this sign, a driver should look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby. Never try to outdrive an oncoming train.

questions.question: When should drivers yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in a crosswalk?
questions.answerA: Only if the pedestrians first wave to the driver.
questions.answerB: Only if the pedestrians are not texting while walking.
questions.explanation: Bring your vehicle to a complete stop at a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to any vehicle or pedestrian already in the intersection. You may carefully proceed if your lane is completely clear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

questions.question: At a railroad crossing, you must:
questions.answerA: Watch for vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings (school buses, trucks carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
questions.explanation: You must approach all railroad crossings with extreme caution and cross only when you know that no train is coming from either direction. Be aware of vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings, such as school buses and trucks carrying hazardous materials.

questions.question: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Slow down and drive carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to other traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when it safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a crossroad ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: An eight-sided red sign means "stop."

questions.question: If you become drowsy while driving, you should:
questions.explanation: If you start to feel tired while driving, drive to the first available rest stop or service area to take a break, nap, stretch, or change drivers. You should not rely on caffeine pills or energy drinks, as these are not a replacement for rest and may make your driving even more dangerous.

questions.question: If you are involved in an accident, one of the immediate requirements is to:
questions.answerC: Notify the Secretary of State's Office.
questions.explanation: Do not assume that a person is not injured simply because that person says they are not. Send for professional help as soon as possible.

questions.question: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:
questions.answerA: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.
questions.answerB: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.
questions.answerC: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.
questions.explanation: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

questions.question: What is the purpose of rumble strips?
questions.answerA: They alert drivers to potential tire problems.
questions.answerB: They test a vehicle's shock absorbers.
questions.answerC: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.
questions.explanation: Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: The road ahead curves left then right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead curves right then left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the upcoming road will curve right, followed by a curve to the left. Drivers should adjust their speed to safely continue on the road.

questions.question: What message will be found on this yellow pennant-shaped sign?
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped yellow signs like this are used to indicate a no passing zone.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn can be made here.
questions.answerB: A left turn can be made only after stopping.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate that the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates the presence of a crosswalk, regardless of if it is marked on the pavement or not. Upon seeing this sign, you should be alert and allow any pedestrians to cross the road safely.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. Warning signs may alert drivers to areas where animals, people, and vehicles are likely to cross traffic.

questions.question: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:
questions.answerA: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Honk your horn to let them know you are there.
questions.explanation: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian with a guide dog or a white cane.

questions.question: This red and white sign means you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
questions.answerC: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.
questions.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars on the right move first.
questions.answerC: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.
questions.explanation: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

questions.question: When driving behind another vehicle at night, you should:
questions.answerA: Keep your headlights on the low beam setting.
questions.answerB: Use your high beam headlights until you are within 10 feet of the vehicle ahead.
questions.explanation: Use high beam headlights only when driving in rural areas and when other cars are not nearby. Lower your headlights to their low beam setting when you are following closely behind another driver.

questions.question: If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Grip the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and exit the traffic lane.
questions.answerC: Brake hard and steer toward the right edge of the roadway.
questions.explanation: If you experience a sudden tire blowout, do not panic. Grasp the steering wheel firmly and take your foot off the accelerator to allow the vehicle to roll to a stop. Lightly apply the breaks when it is safe to do so. Do not move to the shoulder of the road until the car has slowed considerably.

questions.question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
questions.answerA: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
questions.answerC: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
questions.explanation: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.

questions.question: If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive around the crossing gates if you can't see a train.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear, and proceed once the gates are lifted.
questions.answerC: Slow down and drive around the gates.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing where signs, warning devices, or flaggers warn you of the presence of a train. It is illegal to drive around lowered gates.

questions.question: Signs with orange backgrounds are:
questions.explanation: The color orange is used only for construction and maintenance warning signs.

questions.question: Driving more slowly than surrounding traffic is:
questions.answerA: A good idea if the weather is bad.
questions.answerB: Appropriate if you don’t know the speed limit.
questions.answerC: Often a hazard because other drivers may become frustrated and try to pass you.
questions.explanation: Driving more slowly than other traffic can be dangerous. Drivers behind you may become impatient and will be tempted to take dangerous risks to pass you.

questions.question: Which of the following driving skills is/are affected by the use of alcohol and/or drugs?
questions.explanation: Alcohol and other drugs can negatively effect a number of skills needed for safe driving, including a driver's reaction time, coordination, alertness, and ability to concentrate.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: Last turn before a toll road.
questions.explanation: Orange is the standard color for work zone activity. If you see orange signs, cones, or barrels while driving, stay alert and be prepared for unexpected driving conditions. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming flagger whose directions should be obeyed by all drivers.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: A road joins from the right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that the road ahead will turn sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

questions.question: When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
questions.answerA: Stop, regardless of your direction of travel.
questions.answerB: Stop if you are driving in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.explanation: When approaching a school bus that is picking up or dropping off passengers, you must come to a complete stop before reaching the bus, regardless of your direction of travel.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

questions.question: This white sign means:
questions.answerA: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
questions.answerB: Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
questions.answerC: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.
questions.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

questions.question: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
questions.answerA: Other drivers to merge onto the freeway.
questions.answerB: The truck driver to stop the vehicle.
questions.answerC: Other drivers when they want to slow down.
questions.explanation: Because they are larger, trucks take longer to stop than cars traveling at the same speed. Other drivers should not pull in front of a truck and then slow down or stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to prepare to allow traffic to safely merge from the right.

questions.question: If you are facing a green traffic light but the intersection ahead is blocked by traffic, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn left and find another route.
questions.answerB: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
questions.answerC: Follow the other vehicles and enter the intersection.
questions.explanation: Even if you are facing a green traffic light, do not start across the intersection if there are other vehicles blocking your way. If you are caught in the intersection when the light changes to red, your vehicle will block cross traffic. You can get a ticket for blocking an intersection.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

questions.question: If weather or light conditions require you to have your lights on while driving:
questions.explanation: Use your low beam headlights when driving in foggy, snowy, or rainy conditions. Light from high beam headlights will reflect back, causing glare and making it even more difficult to see ahead.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about drugs and driving?
questions.answerA: Any prescription drug is safe to use if you don't feel drowsy.
questions.answerB: Even over-the-counter drugs can impair your driving.
questions.answerC: Only illegal drugs can impair your driving.
questions.explanation: Legal prescription and over-the-counter drugs can impair your ability to drive, including drugs taken for colds, hay fever, allergies, or to calm nerves or muscles. It is illegal to drive while under the influence of any drug that impairs your ability to drive safely; this law does not differentiate between illegal, prescription, or over-the-counter drugs.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there is a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Sharp turn to the right ahead.
questions.answerB: Upcoming sharp left and right turns.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns the driver that there is an upcoming winding road. Speed should be adjusted appropriately.

questions.question: It is very foggy. You should slow down and:
questions.answerB: Turn your lights to their high beam setting.
questions.answerC: Turn your lights to their low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: If you parallel park facing downward on a hill:
questions.answerA: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.
questions.answerB: Turn your wheels away from the side of the road.
questions.explanation: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels toward the curb or edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road without a curb, turn your wheels toward the edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, you must turn your front wheels away from the curb.

questions.question: To see objects in their blind spot when changing lanes, drivers should check:
questions.answerB: Over their left or right shoulder.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's blind spots are the areas that you cannot see in your mirrors. Look over the appropriate shoulder to check your blind spot when changing lanes.

questions.question: The amount of alcohol in the blood is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is a measurement of the percentage of alcohol in the blood. The higher the BAC number, the more impaired a person is.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. These signs alert drivers to areas where bicycles may be crossing.

questions.question: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol?
questions.explanation: Factors affecting a person's absorption of alcohol include the person's weight, their biological sex, the amount of food in their digestive tract, and the number of alcoholic beverages they have consumed. The only thing to do to remove alcohol from a person's system is to wait.

questions.question: You drive defensively when you:
questions.answerA: Put one car length between you and the car ahead.
questions.answerB: Look only at the car in front of you while driving.
questions.answerC: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
questions.explanation: You are driving defensively when you are looking down the road for potential hazards. Constantly staring at the road directly in front of your vehicle is dangerous. As you scan ahead, be alert to vehicles around you.

questions.question: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign?
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

questions.question: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:
questions.answerA: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.
questions.answerB: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.
questions.answerC: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.
questions.explanation: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

questions.question: This sign tells a driver that:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?
questions.answerA: They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
questions.answerC: Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rearview mirrors.
questions.explanation: Blind spots are areas that a driver cannot see if they look in their mirrors. Large trucks have large blind spots that drivers of other vehicles should avoid.

questions.question: What does a traffic signal with a yellow left arrow indicate?
questions.answerA: Drivers should prepare to yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: The protected left turn is about to end.
questions.explanation: When a protected turn arrow changes from green to yellow, drivers must prepare to yield to oncoming traffic. A yellow arrow indicates that the protected left turn is ending.

questions.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct?
questions.answerA: Use your left foot to brake.
questions.answerB: Use your right foot for both braking and accelerating your vehicle.
questions.answerC: You should always brake abruptly to ensure stopping.
questions.explanation: Use your right foot for both braking and accelerating. You should apply the brakes gently with increasing pressure so that your vehicle stops gradually and smoothly.

questions.question: A broken yellow centerline means that:
questions.answerB: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.answerC: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a pedestrian crosswalk.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds in a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the roadway will be slippery when wet and they should reduce their speed accordingly.

questions.question: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.
questions.answerB: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.
questions.answerC: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.
questions.explanation: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerC: Right turns permitted on a red light.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. It is illegal to turn right at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Which of the following driving skills are affected by the use of alcohol and/or drugs?
questions.explanation: Any amount of alcohol acts as a depressant, slowing the function of the nervous system. It will reduce a person's alertness and ability to concentrate, increase their reaction time, and drastically reduce their coordination.

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: A diamond-shaped yellow sign warns of possible danger ahead. Orange signs, which are mostly diamond-shaped, are used to warn of possible dangers in or near work areas.

questions.question: What is the proper way to enter an expressway from the entrance ramp?
questions.answerA: Go down the ramp and cross over to your desired traffic lane as soon as possible.
questions.answerB: Use the acceleration lane to blend into traffic.
questions.answerC: Go down to the bottom of the ramp and come to a complete stop before entering the expressway.
questions.explanation: After entering the entrance ramp, you should move into the acceleration lane. This is the lane that runs alongside the main roadway. In the acceleration lane, you can adjust your speed to the speed of the expressway traffic until it is safe for you to merge into traffic.

questions.question: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
questions.answerA: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.
questions.answerB: Legal to drink alcohol if you're not driving.
questions.answerC: Legal to drink alcohol if you're driving but not drunk.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This warning sign tells drivers to be alert to an intersecting side road ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You can travel in either direction in this lane.
questions.answerC: You are approaching a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate?
questions.answerA: Slower traffic must keep to the right.
questions.answerC: If you miss your exit, you must go to the next exit.
questions.explanation: You should always signal when moving your vehicle to the right or left. On an interstate, you should stay in the right lane if you are moving more slowly than the surrounding traffic. It is illegal to back up or make a U-turn on interstate highways, so if you miss your exit, you should proceed to the next exit.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a stop sign is ahead.

questions.question: Which of the following road surfaces freezes first?
questions.explanation: Pavement on bridges and overpasses can become icy even when other surrounding pavement is dry. Bridges often freeze before, and thaw out after, the rest of a road.

questions.question: You should use your horn when:
questions.answerA: Another vehicle is in your way.
questions.answerB: It may help prevent a collision.
questions.explanation: Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

questions.question: When used on roadways, bicycles are considered:
questions.explanation: Bicycles are considered vehicles when used on roadways. Bicyclists and motorists are expected to follow the same rules of the road.

questions.question: If you are driving and the rear end of your car starts skidding to the left, you should:
questions.answerC: Tap your brakes lightly and shift into neutral.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle enters a skid, you should take your foot off of the brake and steer in the direction that you want to go. For example, if the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should steer to the left. This will help bring the front of the vehicle in line with the rear, thereby straightening out the vehicle's overall direction.

questions.question: Georgia has an Implied Consent Law, which means that:
questions.answerA: You must sign a statement saying that you will not drive a motor vehicle after drinking more than three drinks.
questions.answerB: You agree to be tested for the amount of alcohol in your blood if you are arrested for drunk or impaired driving.
questions.answerC: You consent to have a blood sample taken if an officer stops you for driving recklessly.
questions.explanation: Georgia’s Implied Consent Law requires you to submit to state-administered chemical tests of your blood, breath, urine, or other bodily substances at the request of a law enforcement officer for the purpose of determining if you are under the influence of alcohol or drugs. If you refuse this testing, your driver license will be suspended.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that the roadway is slippery when wet.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Which statement is true?
questions.answerA: You should put on your cruise control near a railroad crossing to maintain a constant speed.
questions.answerB: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger or stop sign.
questions.answerC: You have the right-of-way at a railroad crossing and do not need to stop.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger, stop sign, or warning signal. Use caution when driving near railroad tracks.

questions.question: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:
questions.answerA: Helps you keep up with traffic.
questions.answerB: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.
questions.answerC: Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.
questions.explanation: To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.

questions.question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
questions.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

questions.question: This sign indicates:
questions.answerA: The distance from road surface to a bridge or overpass.
questions.answerB: The maximum legal height of a vehicle allowed in this state.
questions.answerC: The maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
questions.explanation: This is a low clearance warning sign. It indicates the distance from the road surface to the bottom of a bridge or overpass (in this case, 12 feet, 6 inches).

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A five-sided yellow or yellow-green sign alerts drivers to either a school zone or school crossing.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive at a speed appropriate for ideal conditions.
questions.answerB: Apply your brakes as soon as your car starts to skid.
questions.explanation: When driving too quickly in wet conditions, your tires may lose all contact with the road surface. Loss of traction will cause the vehicle to ride on top of the water, which is called "hydroplaning." The best way to prevent this from happening is to drive more slowly in rainy or wet conditions than you would when driving during ideal weather conditions.

questions.question: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:
questions.answerA: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.
questions.answerB: Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: Excessive speed:
questions.answerA: Does not increase the chance of a crash.
questions.answerB: Increases your ability to react to a hazard.
questions.explanation: Excessive speed is one of the most common contributing factors to vehicle crashes. Excessive speed does not save time and often leads to high-risk decision-making.

questions.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
questions.answerA: Driving in both directions may pass.
questions.answerB: Next to the broken line may pass.
questions.answerC: Next to the solid line may pass.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming intersection so they may prepare for potential traffic or prepare to turn.

questions.question: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is:
questions.explanation: Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians who are crossing the street in any marked or unmarked crosswalk. In the interest of safety, drivers should yield the right-of-way to people crossing any street.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of the possible presence of merging traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited. You may see a sign like this at an intersection that commonly has oncoming traffic.

questions.question: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:
questions.answerC: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.
questions.explanation: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

questions.question: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should:
questions.answerA: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
questions.answerC: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.

questions.question: This sign indicates that:
questions.answerA: There is a steep hill ahead.
questions.answerB: No trucks are allowed on the upcoming hill.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should slow down and be ready to control their speed and protect their brakes from damage.

questions.question: If you come to an intersection and your view to the side is blocked, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and look both ways.
questions.answerB: Maintain your speed and look both ways.
questions.answerC: Stop, then inch forward until you can see clearly in both directions.
questions.explanation: Drivers must slow down when approaching an intersection. If a clear view of cross traffic is obscured, a driver should come to a stop and inch forward until they can see clearly in both directions.

questions.question: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when:
questions.answerA: The driver you passed signals for you to return to your lane.
questions.answerB: You signal your intention for three seconds.
questions.answerC: You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: Before you return to your driving lane, be sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. One way to do this is to look for the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror. When you can see both headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

questions.question: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is:
questions.answerB: Allowed only from your direction of travel.
questions.explanation: A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.

questions.question: If a motorist sees pedestrians in an upcoming crosswalk, what should the motorist do?
questions.answerA: Continue ahead. The motorist has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Wait for the pedestrians to cross the street.
questions.answerC: Pull to the right and go around the pedestrians.
questions.explanation: A driver must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian within a crosswalk. The driver should wait until the intersection is clear to proceed.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about driving speed is true?
questions.answerA: As your speed increases, the chance of a fatality increases.
questions.answerB: As your speed increases, so should your following distance.
questions.explanation: As driving speeds increase, the chance of a fatality in the case of a collision increases. If you are going faster than 80 miles per hour, you have almost no chance of living through a crash. The speed you drive affects your stopping distance, so you should increase your following distance as you increase your speed.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:
questions.answerA: The same thing as a yield sign.
questions.answerB: The light is about to turn green.
questions.answerC: The same thing as a stop sign.
questions.explanation: A flashing red light at an intersection means drivers are required to come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear. The same is true at a stop sign.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, you should return to your original lane when:
questions.answerA: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerB: You have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.
questions.answerC: You are 50 feet in front of the passed vehicle.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle, move back into your original lane only when you can see the passed vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror. This ensures that you will have enough room to safely pull back in front of the other vehicle.

questions.question: If you drive more slowly than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
questions.answerA: Interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
questions.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited. You should match the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

questions.question: Fatigue increases the risk of:
questions.answerC: Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.
questions.explanation: Fatigue causes errors related to speed and distance, increases your risk of being in a crash, and causes you to take more time to make decisions. When you are fatigued, you could fall asleep behind the wheel and crash, injuring or killing yourself or others.

questions.question: If you find that the roadway ahead of you is flooded, you should:
questions.answerB: Not drive through the flooded area. Turn around and find another route.
questions.answerC: Drive only in the center of the roadway.
questions.explanation: Never attempt to drive on a flooded road. Even if the water looks shallow, it may hide many kinds of hazards. If you encounter a flooded area, turn around and seek another route to your destination.

questions.question: Before switching on the ignition, you should:
questions.answerB: Be sure all passengers have buckled their safety belts.
questions.explanation: Develop a routine for entering and leaving your car. Before switching on the ignition, buckle your safety belt and see that all passengers do likewise.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you:
questions.answerA: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.
questions.answerB: Will always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.
questions.answerC: Should stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign means drivers cannot make a left turn. It is unsafe and unlawful to make a left turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

questions.question: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:
questions.answerA: Proceed if you have the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.
questions.answerC: Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
questions.explanation: At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of of an approaching traffic signal.

questions.question: If a road is slippery, maintain a following distance that is:
questions.answerB: Farther from the car ahead than normal.
questions.answerC: Closer to the car ahead than normal.
questions.explanation: You need a longer distance to stop your vehicle on a slippery road than you do on a dry road. Maintain an increased following distance when driving on slippery roads.

questions.question: Blue traffic signs offer information on:
questions.answerC: Mileage information, such as distances to specific locations.
questions.explanation: Blue signs on the roadway are service signs. They are used to provide information about motorist services, such as upcoming rest areas, food options, or nearby hospitals.

questions.question: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:
questions.answerA: Ease up on the gas pedal.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, release the accelerator or brake pedal to regain vehicle balance. Steer in the direction of the skid to regain control of the vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a yield sign ahead. You should begin to slow down when you see this warning sign.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You should stop for other traffic.
questions.answerB: Traffic is entering from another road and you should allow additional space for drivers to merge safely into the flow of traffic.
questions.answerC: Traffic is entering from another road and you should keep right.
questions.explanation: This sign alerts you to the possibility of traffic merging into the main stream of travel. After checking to your side and rear, you should move into another lane, if possible, to allow merging motorists a clear path.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead. A merging maneuver will be required for drivers in that lane.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign marks the presence of a crosswalk. Be alert to any pedestrians that may be crossing the roadway.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers that:
questions.answerA: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers to be careful when driving under wet conditions as the pavement will become slippery and more difficult to navigate safely.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a sharp turn to the right.
questions.answerC: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.
questions.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

questions.question: This yellow warning sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
questions.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

questions.question: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must:
questions.answerA: Stay in the right lane as much as possible because the motorcycle is small and doesn't use all of the lane.
questions.answerB: Blow your horn to make the motorcycle move onto the shoulder so that you can pass.
questions.answerC: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.
questions.explanation: When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?
questions.answerA: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
questions.answerB: If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
questions.answerC: Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.
questions.explanation: Being under the influence of alcohol affects your judgment. Good judgement is necessary to react appropriately to things that you see or hear while on the road. Even if you are below the legal blood alcohol limit, consuming any amount of alcohol is likely to affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars in the right lane must slow down.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there could be traffic merging from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You must travel through the intersection at the posted speed limit.
questions.answerB: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions is 55 mph.
questions.answerC: You must not travel below the speed indicated.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This particular sign tells you the maximum speed limit for the stretch of highway where it is posted. You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit.

questions.question: When passing a row of parked vehicles, you should:
questions.answerA: Be prepared for a person or vehicle to unexpectedly enter your lane.
questions.answerB: Expect all other drivers and pedestrians to respect your right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Drive closely to the parked vehicles to allow more room for moving traffic.
questions.explanation: Keep a space between your vehicle and parked vehicles. A person may step out of a parked vehicle or out from between the parked vehicles without looking. A driver may begin moving their vehicle before realizing you are there.

questions.question: To improve visibility lowered by rain or fog, drivers should use their:
questions.explanation: Use low beam headlights when driving in rain, snow, sleet, or fog. High beam headlights in adverse weather conditions lower visibility by reflecting off the precipitation and back into the driver's eyes.

questions.question: Excessive speed:
questions.answerA: Saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
questions.answerC: Increases the likelihood of serious bodily injury and death.
questions.explanation: Excessive speed is one of the most common contributing factors to vehicle crashes. Excessive speed does not save time and often leads to high-risk decision-making.

questions.question: When you see this road sign, you should:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that a divided highway is beginning and cars should keep to the right.

questions.question: Which lane must you be in before making a left turn from a one-way street?
questions.answerA: The lane nearest the left curb.
questions.answerB: The lane nearest the center of the street.
questions.answerC: The lane nearest the right curb.
questions.explanation: When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. If you are making a left turn from a one-way street, this means that you would make the turn from the lane nearest to the left curb.

questions.question: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop until the light turns green.
questions.answerB: Go through the intersection without stopping.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.explanation: Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. Follow the officer's instructions.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.explanation: Solid yellow lines on two-lane roads indicate zones where passing is prohibited. If a solid yellow line appears next to a broken yellow line, drivers in the lane nearest to the solid yellow line may not pass. In some instances, both yellow lines will be solid, indicating that it is not safe to pass from either direction.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a dangerous downgrade or hill ahead. The hill may be very long or steep, or it may have sharp curves.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Watch for people crossing your path.
questions.explanation: This orange warning sign tells drivers that an area of roadwork is upcoming. When traveling through a work zone, stay alert for temporary traffic control devices.

questions.question: Which of these is a safe driving technique?
questions.answerA: Using your high beam lights in the fog.
questions.answerB: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
questions.explanation: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

questions.question: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by:
questions.answerA: Their erratic and improper lane changes.
questions.answerB: The number of passengers in their car.
questions.explanation: While driving, you should remain aware of the actions of surrounding drivers. If you notice an aggressive driver nearby making erratic or improper lane changes, you should not challenge them. The safest way to handle an aggressive driver is to get out of their way.

questions.question: A distraction when driving is:
questions.answerA: Anything that causes evasive action while driving.
questions.answerB: Anything that takes your attention away from driving.
questions.answerC: Anything that causes you to pay more attention to driving.
questions.explanation: A distraction when driving is anything that takes your attention away from driving. Driver distractions may occur anytime and anywhere. Distracted driving can cause collisions, resulting in property damage, injury, and death.

questions.question: Having a driver license is a:
questions.explanation: It is important to remember that driving is a privilege and that all drivers play a role in ensuring that everyone remains safe on the roadways. If you prove to be abusive of that privilege, the privilege may be revoked.

questions.question: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body.
questions.explanation: Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that the divided highway ends ahead. Prepare to change lanes or shift lane position.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

questions.question: This yellow signs means:
questions.answerA: The road ahead has many curves.
questions.answerB: There is a sharp curve in the road ahead.
questions.answerC: The road ahead may be slippery.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead may be slippery when wet.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection that is controlled by a flashing red traffic signal, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.
questions.explanation: Treat a flashing red traffic signal the same as you would treat a stop sign. Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:
questions.answerA: Until after you pass the sign.
questions.answerB: Unless it seems safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

questions.question: The maximum posted speed limit should be driven only:
questions.explanation: The posted maximum speed limit is the fastest legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions. It is safest to drive at the same speed as surrounding traffic, up to the maximum speed limit. Maintaining a safe speed at all times is a responsibility shared by all motorists.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should drive:
questions.answerA: Closer behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
questions.answerB: Farther behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
questions.answerC: To the right side of the truck and wait to pass.
questions.explanation: It is necessary to follow farther behind a large truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle because trucks have larger blind spots.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

questions.question: Increase your following distance when driving behind a large vehicle:
questions.answerA: To better see around the sides of the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Because other drivers tend to pull behind large vehicles before trying to pass them.
questions.answerC: Because following too closely will get you caught in the vehicle's slipstream.
questions.explanation: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, and any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that you are leaving a separated one-way highway and will soon be driving on a two-way highway.

questions.question: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first?
questions.answerA: Turn the front wheels slightly to the left to edge the car back onto the pavement.
questions.answerB: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.
questions.answerC: Apply the brakes and turn the front wheels sharply to the left.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign is posted on one-way streets and other roadways where a driver is not allowed to enter. A driver may see this sign if attempting to enter an expressway ramp in the wrong direction.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane reduction. The right lane ends soon and traffic should merge left.
questions.explanation: A warning sign is usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that the number of lanes ahead is reduced and that traffic will need to merge to the left.

questions.question: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:
questions.explanation: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A round yellow sign indicates that there is a railroad crossing ahead.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Slow down and prepare to stop if cars are approaching you.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop then proceed when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see any oncoming traffic.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road may be slippery when wet. Exercise caution when driving on a slippery road.

questions.question: If your vehicle has a two-part safety belt system, you should:
questions.answerB: Use both the lap and shoulder belts.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle has a two-part seat belt system, be sure to wear both the lap belt and the shoulder belt. Wearing either part alone greatly reduces your protection. If you have an automatic shoulder belt, be sure to buckle your lap belt as well.

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
questions.answerA: Look for a train station ahead.
questions.answerC: Slow down and yield to trains.
questions.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should stop and:
questions.answerA: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.
questions.answerC: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.
questions.explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: A pennant-shaped sign marks the beginning of a no passing zone.

questions.question: A blood alcohol concentration of 0.02 percent:
questions.answerA: Won't have any effect on your driving.
questions.answerB: Won't put other drivers at risk.
questions.answerC: Will double your chances of having an accident.
questions.explanation: Every 0.02 percent increase in blood alcohol concentration nearly doubles a driver's risk of being in a fatal crash.

questions.question: When being passed by another vehicle:
questions.explanation: When being passed, you must yield to the passing vehicle and not increase your speed. Allow the vehicle to safely merge back into your lane.

questions.question: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?
questions.explanation: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

questions.question: An orange-colored sign like this means:
questions.explanation: Orange-colored signs indicate construction areas. Proceed with caution.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Watch for traffic merging from the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs alert drivers to upcoming hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about potential traffic merging into their lane from the right.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?
questions.answerA: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.
questions.answerB: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
questions.answerC: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.
questions.explanation: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign means:
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers of special conditions or hazards ahead. They are typically yellow or orange in color.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
questions.answerC: You may proceed if the way is clear.
