questions.explanation: This sign marks a one-way road, entrance, or exit. If you are facing this sign, traffic is coming toward you. Turn around if you are driving toward this sign.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?
questions.answerA: They take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
questions.answerB: They all have air brakes that allow them to stop quickly.
questions.answerC: They are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
questions.explanation: Large trucks take longer to stop than other vehicles traveling at the same speed. The average passenger vehicle traveling at 55 mph can stop within 400 feet. However, a large truck traveling at the same speed can take almost 800 feet to stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited to make a right turn. It would be unsafe and unlawful to make a right turn at an intersection with this sign.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Double solid yellow lane markings mean that:
questions.answerC: The lane to the right may pass.
questions.explanation: Yellow lane markings indicate a separation of lanes where traffic is traveling in opposite directions. When you see double solid yellow lane markings, passing is prohibited from both directions.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that another road crosses the highway ahead.

questions.question: If a vehicle is equipped with airbags:
questions.answerA: Seat belts should still be worn.
questions.answerB: Seat belts do not need to be worn.
questions.answerC: Seat belts should be worn behind the back.
questions.explanation: Airbags are important safety devices that provide protection in crashes. For best protection, a vehicle's lap and shoulder belts should be used in combination with airbags.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drivers must bear either right or left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

questions.question: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?
questions.answerB: Right, toward the side of the road
questions.answerC: Left, toward the center of the road
questions.explanation: When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Slow down and do not use your brakes.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead becomes slippery when wet.

questions.question: The proper way to make a right turn is to:
questions.answerA: Signal, slow down, and get into the lane closest to the centerline before turning.
questions.answerB: Signal, slow down, and get into the lane closest to the right curb before turning.
questions.answerC: Approach the corner in the lane nearest the right curb, but move over toward the middle of the street before turning.
questions.explanation: Before beginning a right turn, use the appropriate signal to give surrounding drivers adequate notice of your intentions. Slow down and approach the intersection from the right lane, staying as close as is practical to the right curb or edge of the roadway.

questions.question: This symbol is used for:
questions.explanation: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

questions.question: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red:
questions.answerB: Unless you entered the intersection on a yellow light.
questions.answerC: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
questions.explanation: Even if the signal is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
questions.explanation: The only way to remove the impairing effects of alcohol is to give the body time to remove it from the body. Drinking coffee, physical activity, or taking a cold shower will not speed up this process. It takes about one hour to cancel the effects of one drink.

questions.question: Before you change lanes, you should check your mirrors and:
questions.answerA: Never look over your right shoulder.
questions.answerB: Always slow down in your traffic lane.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, it is very important to check behind you. You should look over your shoulder to ensure that you are not getting in the way of vehicles in the lane you want to enter. Before changing lanes, you should also ensure that no drivers are attempting to drive into the same spot from a different lane.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be alert to crossing pedestrians.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a winding road ahead.

questions.question: A pentagon-shaped sign is a:
questions.answerC: School zone or school crossing sign.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign is used to alert drivers to a school zone. Some pentagonal signs specifically indicate crosswalks within school zones where children or other pedestrians may be present.

questions.question: You hit a parked vehicle and can't find the owner. What must you do?
questions.answerA: Call your insurance company when you get home.
questions.answerB: Wait for the owner to return.
questions.answerC: Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you hit a parked vehicle or other property, you must leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to the vehicle or property that you hit.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see oncoming traffic.

questions.question: What is the only effective way to remove alcohol from the body?
questions.explanation: The only way to remove the effects of alcohol from the body is to let time pass. Eating, drinking coffee, or taking a shower will not speed up this process.

questions.question: The maximum speed limit on a rural interstate highway is:
questions.explanation: The maximum traveling speed is 70 miles per hour on a rural interstate in Georgia. You should follow this speed limit when traveling on a rural interstate unless the speed limit is otherwise posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching the end of a divided highway.
questions.answerB: You are approaching the beginning of a divided highway.
questions.answerC: The road will be slippery ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. Keep to the right of the median divider.

questions.question: You should always travel:
questions.answerA: At the speed of vehicles surrounding you.
questions.answerC: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.
questions.explanation: The speed at which you should drive your vehicle depends on road conditions, the weather, and the legal speed limit. You may never drive above the legal speed limit. Decrease your speed when anything makes conditions less than ideal.

questions.question: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?
questions.answerA: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.
questions.answerC: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
questions.explanation: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

questions.question: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:
questions.answerA: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.
questions.answerB: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
questions.answerC: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.
questions.explanation: When a vehicle makes a turn, the rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels. The longer the vehicle, the bigger the difference between the paths of the front and rear wheels. Therefore, long trucks often have to swing wide to complete a right turn.

questions.question: Water on the road can cause a vehicle to hydroplane. Your car may hydroplane at speeds as low as:
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs when there is standing water on a roadway. At speeds up to 35 mph, most tires will channel water away from the tire. As your speed increases past 35 mph, tires cannot channel the water as well and your tires may start to lose contact with the road and ride over the water like a set of water skis.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
questions.answerB: The area is reserved for picking up or dropping off passengers.
questions.explanation: You may not stop, stand, or park at a red-painted curb.

questions.question: If you have to stop on the shoulder of a freeway because of an emergency, you should:
questions.answerA: Raise the hood of your car to indicate trouble and wait in your car for help.
questions.answerB: Stand behind your car to warn traffic that you have stopped.
questions.answerC: Get out of your car and walk for help.
questions.explanation: Stopping on the roadway shoulder is highly dangerous and permitted only in an emergency. If it is necessary to stop, raise the hood of your vehicle and activate your hazard lights to indicate difficulty. Don’t walk along the expressway in search of help.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection with a side road ahead.

questions.question: When you see this black and yellow sign, it means:
questions.answerA: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only.
questions.answerB: There is a detour to the right due to road construction.
questions.answerC: The road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to slow down and prepare for an abrupt change in direction at an extreme angle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign is posted on one-way streets and other roadways where a driver is not allowed to enter. A driver may see this sign if attempting to enter an expressway ramp in the wrong direction.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: All roads are slippery and dangerous when wet. This sign warns of conditions that can cause a driver to lose control of a car. A driver should slow down when coming upon wet pavement because it takes longer to stop.

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: A pennant-shaped sign marks the beginning of a no passing zone.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars on the right move first.
questions.answerC: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.
questions.explanation: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

questions.question: Children on bicycles should be given extra space by motor vehicle operators because:
questions.answerA: They do not have the same physical reflexes as adults.
questions.answerB: They are smaller and more difficult to see than adults.
questions.explanation: Children are often the least predictable pedestrians and the most difficult pedestrians to see. Take extra care to look out for children, especially near schools, bus stops, playgrounds, parks, and ice cream trucks. Be aware of children riding bikes on the sidewalk, as they may come onto the road unexpectedly.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead. A merging maneuver will be required for drivers in that lane.

questions.question: The maximum speed limit on a rural interstate highway is:
questions.explanation: The maximum traveling speed is 70 miles per hour on a rural interstate in Georgia. You should follow this speed limit when traveling on a rural interstate unless the speed limit is otherwise posted.

questions.question: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
questions.answerB: Right, toward the side of the road
questions.answerC: Left, toward the center of the road
questions.explanation: When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

questions.question: If your wheels drop off the roadway or pavement edge, you should:
questions.answerA: Wait until it is safe to do so, then gradually re-enter the roadway.
questions.answerB: Turn back onto the roadway immediately.
questions.explanation: If your wheels drop off the roadway or pavement edge, do not attempt to turn back onto the roadway immediately. Instead, reduce your speed, check traffic, and gradually turn back onto the roadway when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: Regulatory signs are:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs inform drivers of specific laws that must be obeyed. Displayed laws may be about traffic direction, lane use, turning, speed, parking, or special situations. Regulatory signs are commonly white squares or rectangles with black, red, or green letters or symbols.

questions.question: Night driving presents unique problems because:
questions.answerA: The speed limit is increased at night.
questions.answerB: There are fewer cars on the roads at night.
questions.answerC: Distance and vehicle speed are difficult to judge in the dark.
questions.explanation: Night driving creates a unique set of problems for drivers. Due to the reduced visibility, it can be difficult to judge distance and the traveling speeds of other vehicles when driving at night. Drivers can see only as far as their headlights allow.

questions.question: When you see this road sign, you should:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that a divided highway is beginning and cars should keep to the right.

questions.question: This white sign means:
questions.answerA: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
questions.answerB: Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
questions.answerC: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.
questions.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

questions.question: This yellow warning sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
questions.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

questions.question: This bicyclist is signaling:
questions.explanation: Bicycles do not have turn signals so bicyclists use hand and arm signals to alert other drivers to their intentions. If a bicyclist puts their left arm straight out, they are signaling that they intend to turn left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a winding road ahead.

questions.question: Prior to entering a curve:
questions.explanation: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

questions.question: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights:
questions.answerA: Look toward the center of the roadway.
questions.answerB: Look toward the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their headlights, look toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and allow you to see enough of the road to stay on course. Do not try to retaliate by keeping your bright lights on.

questions.question: This sign indicates a:
questions.explanation: Yellow signs with black markings are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazards or special conditions. Round signs are used only to warn about upcoming railroad crossings.

questions.question: You see pedestrians near the road. You should:
questions.answerA: Sound your horn and maintain your speed.
questions.answerB: Speed up to clear the area quickly.
questions.answerC: Slow down and pass with caution.
questions.explanation: Watch for any pedestrian who may cross your path. If you see pedestrians near the road where you are driving, slow down and be prepared to stop, if necessary.

questions.question: Various traffic control devices in construction and maintenance work areas are the color:
questions.explanation: Orange warning signs are used in and around work zones. Use special caution when you see orange signs, cones, or barriers on a roadway.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited. You may see a sign like this at an intersection that commonly has oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Interstate driving requires drivers to:
questions.answerA: Have the ability to safely drive at increased speeds.
questions.explanation: Safe use of the interstate demands drivers be constantly alert and capable of driving at high speeds.

questions.question: Water on the road can cause a vehicle to hydroplane. Your car may hydroplane at speeds as low as:
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs when there is standing water on a roadway. At speeds up to 35 mph, most tires will channel water away from the tire. As your speed increases past 35 mph, tires cannot channel the water as well and your tires may start to lose contact with the road and ride over the water like a set of water skis.

questions.question: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign.
questions.explanation: Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

questions.question: You are involved in a minor collision at an intersection. There are no injuries and there is very little vehicle damage. You should:
questions.answerA: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives.
questions.answerB: Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.
questions.answerC: Not move your vehicle for any reason.
questions.explanation: After a collision, if no one has been injured or killed and you can safely do so, you should move your vehicle out of the traffic lane.

questions.question: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should:
questions.answerB: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.
questions.answerC: Turn your steering wheel to the right to correct the skid.
questions.explanation: If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A round yellow sign indicates that there is a railroad crossing ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

questions.question: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first?
questions.answerA: Turn the front wheels slightly to the left to edge the car back onto the pavement.
questions.answerB: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.
questions.answerC: Apply the brakes and turn the front wheels sharply to the left.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign marks the presence of a crosswalk. Be alert to any pedestrians that may be crossing the roadway.

questions.question: You are entering a freeway. Check traffic on the freeway by:
questions.answerA: Using your rearview and side mirrors.
questions.answerC: Using your side mirror and looking over your shoulder.
questions.explanation: When entering any roadway, you must be aware of traffic conditions. Use your side mirror and look over your shoulder to help you see and anticipate traffic when entering a freeway.

questions.question: This sign indicates:
questions.answerA: The distance from road surface to a bridge or overpass.
questions.answerB: The maximum legal height of a vehicle allowed in this state.
questions.answerC: The maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
questions.explanation: This is a low clearance warning sign. It indicates the distance from the road surface to the bottom of a bridge or overpass (in this case, 12 feet, 6 inches).

questions.question: This red and white sign means you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
questions.answerC: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.
questions.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

questions.question: If a child is about to run into the street, you should:
questions.answerA: Start to prepare to slow down.
questions.answerC: Sound a sharp blast of your horn.
questions.explanation: If there is danger, you may need to sound a sharp blast on your horn. Do this when a child or any other pedestrian is about to enter into the street in front of your moving vehicle.

questions.question: If pedestrians are illegally crossing in the middle of the street instead of in a crosswalk, you:
questions.answerB: Do not have to stop for them.
questions.answerC: Should honk your horn at them.
questions.explanation: You must yield to pedestrians at all times. If the pedestrians are jaywalking or crossing the street where they should not be, you must still stop for them.

questions.question: When approaching a person who is crossing the street while using a white cane or guide dog, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop until the person is well away from your path of travel.
questions.answerB: Honk your horn as you proceed past them.
questions.explanation: When approaching a pedestrian who is using a white cane or guide dog while crossing the street, you must stop until the person is well away from your path of travel. Always yield the right-of-way to blind pedestrians.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: A road joins from the right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that the road ahead will turn sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Watch for people crossing your path.
questions.explanation: This orange warning sign tells drivers that an area of roadwork is upcoming. When traveling through a work zone, stay alert for temporary traffic control devices.

questions.question: At an intersection with stop signs on all corners, yield the right-of-way to any driver:
questions.explanation: After coming to a full stop, vehicles should proceed through a four-way stop in the order in which they arrive to the intersection. If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the left must yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on the right.

questions.question: In rainy weather, you should be most careful when turning or stopping:
questions.answerA: After it has been raining all day.
questions.answerB: One half hour after it stops raining.
questions.answerC: During the first half hour of rain.
questions.explanation: You should be extra careful when turning and stopping during the first half hour of rain. At this point, the oil from cars has not yet washed off the pavement and could be forming a slippery mixture with the rain.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see oncoming traffic.

questions.question: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must:
questions.answerA: Stay in the right lane as much as possible because the motorcycle is small and doesn't use all of the lane.
questions.answerB: Blow your horn to make the motorcycle move onto the shoulder so that you can pass.
questions.answerC: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.
questions.explanation: When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds in a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the roadway will be slippery when wet and they should reduce their speed accordingly.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Change in direction or narrowing of roadway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns a driver of a change in direction or a narrowing of the road. A driver may find several of these signs on the outside of a sharp curve or on approaches to a narrow bridge.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign is displayed on slow-moving vehicles.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

questions.question: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow to a speed no faster than 10 mph.
questions.answerB: Stop until the lights stop flashing.
questions.explanation: The flashing overhead lights and stop arm on a school bus will be activated when the bus is stopped to load or unload students. If approaching a bus using these signals, you may not proceed until the red lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm has been retracted. Never pass a school bus that is dropping off or picking up students.

questions.question: This sign indicates that:
questions.answerA: There is a steep hill ahead.
questions.answerB: No trucks are allowed on the upcoming hill.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should slow down and be ready to control their speed and protect their brakes from damage.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.

questions.question: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and:
questions.answerA: Turn the front wheels toward the curb.
questions.answerB: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.
questions.explanation: When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.

questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
questions.answerB: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
questions.answerC: Change lanes and maintain your current speed.
questions.explanation: As you enter a work zone, signs and message boards will warn you of workers, slow-moving equipment, and/or closed lanes ahead. You should reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop.

questions.question: The first thing that alcohol effects is:
questions.explanation: Alcohol reduces all of the important abilities you need to drive safely. Alcohol goes from your stomach to your blood, then from your blood to all other parts of your body. Alcohol affects the areas of your brain that control judgment and skill.

questions.question: Streets and highways are most slippery:
questions.answerA: When it has been raining hard for several hours.
questions.answerB: When they are clean and dry.
questions.answerC: Just after it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: Driving during the first half hour of rainfall is dangerous because roadways become extremely slippery when the water mixes with oil and other chemicals on the road surfaces that have not yet washed away. Use extra caution when driving on slippery roads.

questions.question: If you are driving and you see animals standing near the roadway:
questions.answerA: Speed up to scare them away.
questions.answerB: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Quickly swerve into the next lane.
questions.explanation: Slow down and proceed with caution if you see animals that are standing near the roadway. They may unexpectedly bolt or change direction at the last moment. Some animals travel in packs, so there may be more animals just out of sight that are also near the road.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign is used to warn drivers about an upcoming curve to the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn can be made here.
questions.answerB: A left turn can be made only after stopping.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate that the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: At dawn or dusk and in rain or snow, it can be hard to see and be seen. A good way to let other drivers know you are there is to turn:
questions.explanation: You must use your headlights at any time when conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles and when it may be difficult for other drivers to see you. Always use your low beam headlights if weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers.

questions.question: Georgia has an Implied Consent Law, which means that:
questions.answerA: You must sign a statement saying that you will not drive a motor vehicle after drinking more than three drinks.
questions.answerB: You agree to be tested for the amount of alcohol in your blood if you are arrested for drunk or impaired driving.
questions.answerC: You consent to have a blood sample taken if an officer stops you for driving recklessly.
questions.explanation: Georgia’s Implied Consent Law requires you to submit to state-administered chemical tests of your blood, breath, urine, or other bodily substances at the request of a law enforcement officer for the purpose of determining if you are under the influence of alcohol or drugs. If you refuse this testing, your driver license will be suspended.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. You cannot make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: When entering traffic after being parked at a curb, you:
questions.answerA: Should drive more slowly than other traffic for 200 feet.
questions.answerB: Should wait for a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Should wait for the first two vehicles to pass, then drive into the lane.
questions.explanation: Any time that you merge into city or highway traffic, you should wait for a gap in traffic large enough for your vehicle to get up to the speed of other traffic.

questions.question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
questions.answerA: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.
questions.answerB: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.
questions.answerC: The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.
questions.explanation: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

questions.question: If you have a sudden tire blowout:
questions.explanation: If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle moving straight. Slow down gradually by taking your foot off the gas pedal and using the brakes lightly.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection with a steady yellow traffic light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
questions.explanation: When a steady yellow light appears on a traffic signal, you should prepare to stop. If you are already within the intersection, you should clear the intersection as quickly as possible.

questions.question: Blind spots are:
questions.answerA: Spots in your vision when you become fatigued.
questions.answerB: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

questions.question: What is the proper way to enter an expressway from the entrance ramp?
questions.answerA: Go down the ramp and cross over to your desired traffic lane as soon as possible.
questions.answerB: Use the acceleration lane to blend into traffic.
questions.answerC: Go down to the bottom of the ramp and come to a complete stop before entering the expressway.
questions.explanation: After entering the entrance ramp, you should move into the acceleration lane. This is the lane that runs alongside the main roadway. In the acceleration lane, you can adjust your speed to the speed of the expressway traffic until it is safe for you to merge into traffic.

questions.question: When driving behind another vehicle at night, you should:
questions.answerA: Keep your headlights on the low beam setting.
questions.answerB: Use your high beam headlights until you are within 10 feet of the vehicle ahead.
questions.explanation: Use high beam headlights only when driving in rural areas and when other cars are not nearby. Lower your headlights to their low beam setting when you are following closely behind another driver.

questions.question: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your:
questions.answerA: Left, your right, then your left again.
questions.explanation: Before you enter an intersection, look to both the left and right for approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. Look to your left a second time, as vehicle approaching from your left will be closer than those approaching from your right. Look across the intersection before you start to move to make sure the path is clear all the way through.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You can travel in either direction in this lane.
questions.answerC: You are approaching a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching the end of a divided highway.
questions.answerB: You are approaching the beginning of a divided highway.
questions.answerC: The road will be slippery ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. Keep to the right of the median divider.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Slow down and do not use your brakes.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead becomes slippery when wet.

questions.question: When driving in work zones, you should:
questions.answerA: Follow the driver in front of you closely.
questions.answerB: Pass the driver in front of you as soon as you can.
questions.answerC: Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.
questions.explanation: When driving in a work zone, keep a safe distance between your vehicle and traffic barriers, trucks, construction equipment, workers, and other vehicles. Increase your following distance and do not tailgate.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a sharp turn to the right.
questions.answerC: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.
questions.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers that:
questions.answerA: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to prepare to allow traffic to safely merge from the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: Double solid yellow line markings down the center of a road indicate that passing is:
questions.answerB: Allowed only from your direction of travel.
questions.explanation: A double yellow centerline means that it is prohibited for traffic from either direction to cross the centerline to pass.

questions.question: What message will be found on this yellow pennant-shaped sign?
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped yellow signs like this are used to indicate a no passing zone.

questions.question: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
questions.answerA: You should speed up so you can make the turn before the light changes.
questions.answerB: You do not need to signal to turn from the indicated lane.
questions.answerC: You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow means that the protection of a green arrow is ending. If you are turning in the direction of the arrow, you should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic before turning.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a pedestrian crosswalk.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drivers must bear either right or left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

questions.question: If you are involved in an accident, one of the immediate requirements is to:
questions.answerC: Notify the Secretary of State's Office.
questions.explanation: Do not assume that a person is not injured simply because that person says they are not. Send for professional help as soon as possible.

questions.question: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign?
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be alert to crossing pedestrians.

questions.question: When driving at night on a dimly lit street, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive slowly enough that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.
questions.answerB: Turn on your high beam headlights to better see the vehicles ahead of you.
questions.answerC: Keep the instrument panel lights bright to be more visible to other drivers.
questions.explanation: You should drive more slowly at night than during the day because it is not possible to see as far ahead at night. You should make sure that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.

questions.question: Only ____ can lower blood alcohol concentration (BAC) and reduce alcohol's effects on a body.
questions.explanation: The only way to sober up after drinking alcohol is to allow time for your body to eliminate the alcohol in your system. Nothing you can do, including eating and drinking, can accelerate this process.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that you are leaving a separated one-way highway and will soon be driving on a two-way highway.

questions.question: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane:
questions.answerA: If the other driver signals for you to re-enter the lane.
questions.answerB: If you look over your shoulder and see the passed car behind you.
questions.answerC: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

questions.question: Allow extra space in front of your vehicle when following a:
questions.explanation: Allow for extra space when driving behind a motorcycle. Motorcycles can stop more quickly than other vehicles can and you must have adequate room to stop if the motorcyclist brakes or falls off. Also, remember that motorcycles are difficult to see at night because they only have one tail light.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane if you:
questions.answerA: Cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
questions.answerB: See the vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
questions.explanation: Before returning to your original lane after passing, you must make sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. When you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to the lane.

questions.question: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should:
questions.answerA: Quickly turn before the truck or bus is able to.
questions.answerB: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.
questions.answerC: Squeeze between the truck or bus and the curb.
questions.explanation: If you try to insert your vehicle between a turning truck or bus and a curb, you may suffer a serious crash. To avoid a collision, do not turn until the truck or bus has completed its turn.

questions.question: "No passing zone" signs tell drivers:
questions.answerB: That it is not safe to pass.
questions.explanation: If you come across a "No passing zone" sign, it is not legal to pass in the indicated area. You are likely driving in an area with restricted visibility where it would be unsafe to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

questions.question: When driving on gravel or dirt roads:
questions.answerA: Your tires grip the road better than when you are driving on pavement.
questions.answerB: Your tires do not have as much traction as they do on pavement, so you must slow down.
questions.answerC: Visibility is better than on pavement.
questions.explanation: Your tires do not have as much traction on loose gravel and dirt roads as they do on concrete and asphalt roads. When driving on gravel or dirt, you must slow down. It will take you much longer to stop and it is much easier to skid when turning.

questions.question: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking:
questions.answerA: Park with your reverse lights on.
questions.answerB: Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.
questions.answerC: Park five feet from the curb.
questions.explanation: Drivers are responsible for making sure their vehicles do not become hazards after they have been parked. Wherever you park, make sure your car is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.explanation: Solid yellow lines on two-lane roads indicate zones where passing is prohibited. If a solid yellow line appears next to a broken yellow line, drivers in the lane nearest to the solid yellow line may not pass. In some instances, both yellow lines will be solid, indicating that it is not safe to pass from either direction.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that another road crosses the highway ahead.

questions.question: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should:
questions.answerA: Maintain your speed and force the other drivers to create a gap.
questions.answerB: Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.
questions.answerC: Stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap.
questions.explanation: If you want to enter the freeway but do not see a space for your vehicle in traffic, slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap. Do not drive to the end of the ramp and wait for a gap or you will not have enough room to accelerate to the speed of traffic before entering the roadway.

questions.question: If you are driving near a large commercial vehicle, you should:
questions.answerA: Follow the large vehicle closely to reduce wind drag on your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Avoid driving beside it for long stretches of time.
questions.answerC: Drive on its right side when on curves and hills.
questions.explanation: Because large commercial vehicles have large blind spots on each side, you should avoid driving beside them for long periods of time.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers to be careful when driving under wet conditions as the pavement will become slippery and more difficult to navigate safely.

questions.question: Reaction time is slower after:
questions.explanation: Alcohol slows your reflexes and reaction time, reduces your ability to see clearly, and makes you less alert. As the amount of alcohol in your body increases, your judgment worsens and your driving skills decrease. You will have trouble judging distances, speeds, and the movement of other vehicles.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Sharp turn to the right ahead.
questions.answerB: Upcoming sharp left and right turns.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns the driver that there is an upcoming winding road. Speed should be adjusted appropriately.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
questions.answerC: Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

questions.question: Drivers are required to obey instructions from:
questions.answerB: Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway.
questions.explanation: Drivers must obey special signs or instructions given by flaggers. They are in place to keep drivers and workers safe.

questions.question: What does this road sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

questions.question: What is the only medically proven method of removing alcohol or other drug combinations from your system?
questions.explanation: Alcohol takes effect quickly and is slow to leave your system. Cold showers, black coffee, and exercise will do nothing to reduce a person's blood alcohol content (BAC). The only way to lower your BAC is to wait.

questions.question: This sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing that does not have a signal. You should:
questions.answerB: Proceed at a consistent speed while looking and listening for approaching trains.
questions.answerC: Slow down, look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing marked with this sign, a driver should look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby. Never try to outdrive an oncoming train.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited to make a right turn. It would be unsafe and unlawful to make a right turn at an intersection with this sign.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Drive with caution and be ready to stop.
questions.answerB: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: The stop sign is the only eight-sided sign you will see on any roadway. When you encounter a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop. You may not proceed until the way is clear for you to completely and safely pass through the intersection.

questions.question: A driver should:
questions.answerA: Assume all drivers automatically obey the right-of-way rules.
questions.answerB: Assume most drivers obey the right-of-way rules.
questions.answerC: Always be prepared to yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Although the right-of-way rules provide a guide to determine who should yield the right-of-way at an intersection, no one should assume they automatically have the right-of-way. The situation and circumstances at an intersection must always be considered. Drivers should yield their legal right-of-way if it can help prevent a collision.

questions.question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:
questions.answerC: If it is prescribed by a physician.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Watch for traffic merging from the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs alert drivers to upcoming hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about potential traffic merging into their lane from the right.

questions.question: When driving under snowy or icy conditions:
questions.answerA: It is safe to use your cruise control.
questions.answerB: Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.
questions.answerC: Drive as you would under normal conditions.
questions.explanation: When driving under snowy or icy conditions, you should make speed and directional changes gradually. Never use cruise control when driving on snow or ice because your tires may lose contact with the road and you will lose control of your vehicle.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there is a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

questions.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: An eight-sided red sign means "stop."

questions.question: If you are driving and a tire suddenly goes flat, you should:
questions.answerA: Rapidly pump the brake pedal several times.
questions.answerB: Slow down gradually and not brake.
questions.answerC: Press down on the brake pedal as hard as you can.
questions.explanation: If a tire blows out or suddenly goes flat while you are driving, grip the steering wheel firmly and keep the vehicle aiming straight. Take your foot off the accelerator and do not brake. Allow the vehicle to slow by itself and use the brakes gently, but only if necessary. Pull off the road when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Grip the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and exit the traffic lane.
questions.answerC: Brake hard and steer toward the right edge of the roadway.
questions.explanation: If you experience a sudden tire blowout, do not panic. Grasp the steering wheel firmly and take your foot off the accelerator to allow the vehicle to roll to a stop. Lightly apply the breaks when it is safe to do so. Do not move to the shoulder of the road until the car has slowed considerably.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a dangerous downgrade or hill ahead. The hill may be very long or steep, or it may have sharp curves.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a stop sign is ahead.

questions.question: Adjust your rearview and side mirrors:
questions.answerB: Whenever you need to use them.
questions.answerC: Before you get into the car.
questions.explanation: Your safety and the safety of other drivers and pedestrians depends a lot on what you do before driving. Before moving your vehicle, you should adjust your seat, adjust your mirrors, fasten your safety belt, and secure items in and on your vehicle. Do not wait until your vehicle is moving to adjust your mirrors.

questions.question: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid yellow line.
questions.answerB: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that traffic in the lane next to the broken line may cross the line to pass, while traffic in the lane next to the solid line may not.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A triangular red and white sign indicates that you must yield the right-of-way.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: When crossing a sidewalk to enter traffic from an alley or driveway, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Stop only if pedestrians are on the sidewalk.
questions.answerB: Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.
questions.answerC: Expect pedestrians on the sidewalk to yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: When leaving an alley, driveway, or parking lot to enter a roadway, you must stop before driving onto a sidewalk or sidewalk area. Pedestrians and existing traffic have the right-of-way.

questions.question: If you are driving on a highway next to a single broken white line marking:
questions.answerA: You cannot cross the line to pass.
questions.answerB: You may cross the line to pass and change lanes.
questions.answerC: You may only cross the line to change lanes if you are in the left lane.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. You may cross a dashed white line to pass or change lanes if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: Last turn before a toll road.
questions.explanation: Orange is the standard color for work zone activity. If you see orange signs, cones, or barrels while driving, stay alert and be prepared for unexpected driving conditions. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming flagger whose directions should be obeyed by all drivers.

questions.question: If you want to pass a pedestrian who is walking along the roadway and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass before you pass the pedestrian.
questions.answerB: Keep driving at a steady speed. The oncoming vehicle must stop for you.
questions.answerC: Honk your horn to get the pedestrian to move over.
questions.explanation: If possible, try to only deal with one roadway hazard at a time. If you want to pass a pedestrian but an oncoming vehicle is approaching, slow down and let the vehicle pass. You may then pass the pedestrian if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When a bicyclist is making a left turn:
questions.answerA: They may use the left lane.
questions.answerB: They may cut through all lanes.
questions.answerC: They may wait on the side of the road.
questions.explanation: You should expect to see bicyclists driving with traffic on the road. You should not be surprised to see a bicyclist using the left lane when turning.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a minimum blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of:
questions.explanation: For drivers age 21 or older, it is illegal to operate a motor vehicle with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.08 percent or higher. Driving while under the influence of alcohol is not only illegal, but dangerous.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign means drivers cannot make a left turn. It is unsafe and unlawful to make a left turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: If a tire blows out, you should:
questions.answerA: Apply the brake and hold it.
questions.answerB: Hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
questions.explanation: If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle going straight.You should slow down gradually, taking your foot off the gas pedal and using the brakes lightly. Do not stop on the road if at all possible. Pull off the road in a safe place.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

questions.question: The best thing to do if you become tired while driving is to:
questions.answerA: Stop to rest or change drivers.
questions.explanation: If you become tired while driving, it is best to stop to rest or change drivers. Being tired dulls your mind and slows down your reactions, making driving hazardous.

questions.question: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street:
questions.answerA: You must always yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: You must tell them where to cross the street.
questions.answerC: You only have to yield the right-of-way if you are at a corner.
questions.explanation: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian who is using a guide dog or carrying a white cane.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
questions.answerA: Look for a train station ahead.
questions.answerC: Slow down and yield to trains.
questions.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

questions.question: Blue traffic signs offer information on:
questions.answerC: Mileage information, such as distances to specific locations.
questions.explanation: Blue signs on the roadway are service signs. They are used to provide information about motorist services, such as upcoming rest areas, food options, or nearby hospitals.

questions.question: If you come to an intersection controlled by a flashing yellow light, you must:
questions.answerA: Wait for the green light before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers must slow down, be more aware, and proceed with caution. Be alert to crossing traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: To help others see you when daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
questions.explanation: As daylight begins to fade, turn on your low beams to help others see you. Only use your high beam headlights in an open area where no other drivers are present.

questions.question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
questions.answerB: Cough syrups and cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
questions.explanation: A number of drugs can impair your ability to drive, including depressant medications like tranquilizers and sedatives; over-the-counter cough syrups, cold tablets, and allergy medications (which may contain impairing substances like alcohol, codeine, or antihistamines); and illegal drugs.

questions.question: You may pass a vehicle when:
questions.answerA: You are on a hill or curve.
questions.answerB: You are on a road with a solid line next to your lane.
questions.answerC: You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.
questions.explanation: A single broken line indicates that drivers may cross from either lane to change lanes. Dashed yellow lines alongside solid yellow lines indicate that passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line, but not from the lane next to the solid line. Only change lanes when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
questions.answerA: Any lane (as long as it is safe).
questions.answerB: The lane closest to the left curb.
questions.answerC: The lane in the center of the road.
questions.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a steep downgrade is ahead on the road. Drivers should check their brakes.

questions.question: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:
questions.explanation: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

questions.question: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you:
questions.answerA: Are following a small passenger vehicle.
questions.answerB: Are being tailgated by another driver.
questions.answerC: Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.
questions.explanation: When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

questions.question: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:
questions.answerB: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Wait for a green light before proceeding.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down, check for cross traffic, and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should stop and:
questions.answerA: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.
questions.answerC: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.
questions.explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

questions.question: Signs with orange backgrounds are:
questions.explanation: The color orange is used only for construction and maintenance warning signs.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. Warning signs may alert drivers to areas where animals, people, and vehicles are likely to cross traffic.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming intersection so they may prepare for potential traffic or prepare to turn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that the divided highway ends ahead. Prepare to change lanes or shift lane position.

questions.question: Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
questions.answerA: Help you to be a better driver.
questions.explanation: Not getting enough sleep is a cause of poor driving behavior. Just like drugs and alcohol, sleepiness slows reaction time, decreases awareness, and impairs judgment.

questions.question: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane:
questions.answerB: When you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
questions.answerC: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead.

questions.question: A pentagon-shaped sign is a:
questions.answerC: School zone or school crossing sign.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign is used to alert drivers to a school zone. Some pentagonal signs specifically indicate crosswalks within school zones where children or other pedestrians may be present.

questions.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always:
questions.answerB: Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
questions.answerC: Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason.
questions.explanation: Any time you come to a place where people may cross or enter your path, or where one line of traffic meets another, you should look to the left and right sides of your vehicle to make sure no one is coming.

questions.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:
questions.answerB: Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
questions.answerC: You may proceed if the way is clear.
questions.explanation: This sign marks a one-way road, entrance, or exit. If you are facing this sign, traffic is coming toward you. Turn around if you are driving toward this sign.

questions.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:
questions.answerA: Until after you pass the sign.
questions.answerB: Unless it seems safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

questions.question: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down by shifting into a lower gear.
questions.answerB: Ease your foot off the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Slow down by pumping the brakes quickly and firmly.
questions.explanation: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should ease your foot off the gas pedal and stay off the brakes. Do not try to stop or turn until your tires are gripping the road again.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A five-sided yellow or yellow-green sign alerts drivers to either a school zone or school crossing.

questions.question: Broken yellow lines are used on streets and highways to:
questions.answerB: Separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Dashed lines on the pavement indicate that passing is permitted when safe.

questions.question: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper):
questions.answerA: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
questions.answerB: Cannot result in a traffic citation.
questions.answerC: Reduces collisions by preventing being "cut off."
questions.explanation: Tailgating is a common behavior that can lead to aggressive driving, and so it should be avoided. Drivers may face legal consequences for driving unsafely.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This warning sign tells drivers to be alert to an intersecting side road ahead.

questions.question: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should:
questions.explanation: To prevent hydroplaning, lower your speed in response to wet roads and keep your tires in good condition. If you detect a loss of control, take your foot off the gas, do not apply the brakes, maintain the direction of the vehicle, and allow the vehicle to slow to a manageable speed.

questions.question: You may pass on the right of another vehicle:
questions.answerA: When traveling either on a multilane highway or on a street with an available turning lane.
questions.answerB: Only when traveling on a multilane highway with two or more lanes of traffic traveling in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Only when the other vehicle is making or is about to make a left turn and a lane is provided for you to pass on the right.
questions.explanation: You may pass on the right of another vehicle making or about to make a left turn if there is sufficient pavement width for both your vehicle and the vehicle making the left turn.
